meanings.definition: A temporary loss of consciousness or memory.
meanings.sent1: During the play, the character experienced sudden blackouts on stage.
meanings.sent2: The doctor diagnosed the patient with frequent blackouts due to low blood pressure.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved fake blackouts to surprise the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a maze of blackouts, memories slipping away like sand through her fingers.
meanings.sent5: The blackout of her memory left her feeling disoriented and confused.

meanings.definition: A period of time when all lights or power sources are turned off.
meanings.sent1: The city experienced frequent blackouts during the storm.
meanings.sent2: The blackout in the neighborhood lasted for hours, causing inconvenience to residents.
meanings.sent3: The blackout during the movie added to the suspense of the scene.
meanings.sent4: In the blackout of night, the stars shone brighter than ever before.
meanings.sent5: The blackout plunged the room into complete darkness, making it impossible to see anything.

meanings.definition: A restriction on the broadcasting of a television or radio program.
meanings.sent1: The blackout of the live sports event disappointed many fans.
meanings.sent2: The blackout of the news channel was due to technical difficulties.
meanings.sent3: The blackout of the radio show led to an unexpected silence on air.
meanings.sent4: The blackout of the TV program left viewers wondering about the outcome.
meanings.sent5: The blackout of the broadcast caused confusion among listeners tuning in.
